abstract: A state-run newspaper says the network equipment maker has close ties with the U.S. government and military, which the company denies.
snippet: A state-run newspaper says the network equipment maker has close ties with the U.S. government and military, which the company denies.
lead_paragraph: TAIPEI, Taiwan — Amid heightening tension between Washington and Beijing over online espionage, a Chinese state media outlet has sharply criticized the American network equipment maker Cisco Systems, saying it is complicit with United States cyberspying. Cisco denied the accusations.

headline.main: China Pulls Cisco Into Dispute on Cyberspying
headline.print_headline: China Pulls Cisco Into Dispute on Cyberspying
